Items.Definition: A time or date by which something must be finished.
Items.Example: The team worked late to meet the project deadline.

Items.Definition: A formal, usually written, agreement between two or more people or companies.
Items.Example: Both companies signed a two‑year contract for the supply of materials.

Items.Definition: A document that lists goods or services provided and shows how much money is owed.
Items.Example: Please send the invoice to our accounting department.

Items.Definition: Formal discussions in which people try to reach an agreement.
Items.Example: After long negotiation, they agreed on a lower price.

Items.Definition: A person that you work with, especially in a profession or business.
Items.Example: My colleagues and I usually have lunch together.
The company holds an annual meeting for all staff.

Items.Definition: A move to a more important job or position in a company.
Items.Example: She received a promotion after two years of excellent performance.

Items.Definition: A company or person that provides goods or services.
Items.Example: We changed our supplier to reduce costs.

Items.Definition: A plan of how much money will be spent and how it will be used.
Items.Example: The marketing budget for next year has been increased.

Items.Definition: A list of items to be discussed at a meeting.
Items.Example: The first item on the agenda is last month’s sales report.
